title: 2025 Nobel in Chemistry for Pioneers of Pollution-Fighting Frameworks
snippets: Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar M. Yaghi will share the prize. Their structures can "capture carbon dioxide, store toxic gases or catalyse chemical reactions," the committee said.
Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar M Yaghi's work can be used to harvest water from desert air.
The work that won Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar M. Yaghi the 2025 Nobel Prize in chemistry could help tackle challenges such as climate change and lack of fresh water.

Scientists Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar M. Yaghi won the Nobel Prize in chemistry on Wednesday for their development of metal–organic frameworks, which an expert likened to Hermione Granger's enchanted handbag in the fictional "Harry Potter" series.
titles: Research on metal-organic frameworks gets the chemistry Nobel Prize
Chemistry Nobel Prize awarded to trio in field of metal organic frameworks
Trio wins chemistry Nobel Prize for metal organic framework
Three scientists win Nobel Prize in chemistry for the development of metal-organic frameworks
summary: Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson, and Omar M. Yaghi were awarded the 2025 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for their development of metal–organic frameworks. These structures are capable of capturing carbon dioxide, storing toxic gases, catalyzing chemical reactions, and harvesting water from desert air. Their groundbreaking work offers potential solutions to global challenges like climate change and water scarcity.

title: Sullivan's Rangers Debut Ends in 3-0 Loss to Penguins

Justin Brazeau scored twice for the Penguins, and Arturs Silovs achieved his first regular-season NHL shutout by stopping all 25 shots from the Rangers.

title: 900 Stranded on Everest's Chinese Side Rescued After Snowstorm
snippets: About 900 hikers, guides and other staff who were stranded by a weekend snowstorm on the Chinese side of Mount Everest have reached safety, state media said late Tuesday.
Those rescued included guides, yak herders and trekkers, who were trapped in a heavy snowstorm that began on Friday.
Some 580 hikers and over 300 mountain guides, yak handlers or support staff were rescued, Chinese state media said, after heavy snows stranded them on Mount Everest.
titles: Hundreds of hikers rescued from Mount Everest after severe snowstorm
Hundreds of Everest hikers reach safety after snowstorm in Tibetan valley
Hundreds of Mount Everest hikers rescued from snowstorm, 10 remain
summary: Approximately 900 individuals, including hikers, guides, yak herders, and staff, stranded by a weekend snowstorm on the Chinese side of Mount Everest, were safely rescued by late Tuesday. The group, caught in a heavy snowstorm starting Friday, has now reached safety, according to state media reports.

Energy storage and new materials eyed for chemistry Nobel
summary: The Nobel Prize in Chemistry 2025 was awarded to three scientists for their development of revolutionary porous materials with applications in gas storage and drug delivery. This announcement was made by the Nobel committee in Sweden, highlighting the trio's contributions to the field.

title: OMB: 2019 Back Pay Law Doesn't Cover Furloughed Workers Amid Shutdown

titles: White House floats no back pay for some furloughed federal workers despite 2019 law

summary: The White House's Office of Management and Budget (OMB) contends that a 2019 law ensuring federal employees receive back pay after a shutdown does not apply to furloughed workers. This interpretation has sparked controversy amid the ongoing government shutdown, leaving furloughed federal employees at risk of not getting back pay as previously guaranteed by the 2019 legislation.

title: Ontario Hospitals Need $1B Amid Rising Deficits, Association Says
snippets: Hospitals across the province struggled with deficits, with many of them — small and large, urban and rural — ending the year in the red.

Ontario hospitals need an additional $1 billion this year to keep pace with factors such as population growth and inflation, leaving them facing pressures far higher than the deficits they faced just at the end of last year, their association says. Hospitals across the province struggled with defici
titles: Ontario hospitals say they have $1 billion in funding needs
Ontario hospitals say they have $1 billion in funding needs
summary: Hospitals in Ontario are facing significant financial strain, with deficits reported across both small and large, urban and rural institutions. The Ontario Hospital Association has stated that an additional $1 billion is needed this year to address challenges stemming from population growth and inflation. This amount exceeds the deficits recorded at the end of the previous year, highlighting increasing financial pressures on the healthcare system.

title: Louisiana Police Release Video of Fatal Crash Involving Ex-LSU Player Lacy

summary: Louisiana State Police released video and records of a fatal crash in December 2024, attributing the cause to former LSU football player Kyren Lacy. However, Lacy's attorney disputes the police's portrayal of Lacy's involvement in the incident, suggesting a misrepresentation.

title: UK Drops Spying Charges Against Two Men Due to Insufficient Evidence

Charges against two men accused of spying for China
titles: Spy case collapse blamed on UK government failure to label China a threat
China ‘spies’ case was dropped after government failed to provide evidence of Beijing threat
summary: British prosecutors dropped charges against two men accused of spying for China due to a lack of evidence. Despite efforts over many months, prosecutors could not obtain necessary statements from ministers and officials to meet the threshold for prosecution.

title: Myanmar Military Attack on Sagaing Festival Leaves Many Dead
snippets: Locals tell the BBC the carnage has made it hard to identify victims of the military attack.
The junta targeted a  festival in the Sagaing region where people were also protesting army rule, according to witnesses and the civilian government in exile.
titles: At least 24 killed as army paraglider bombs Myanmar Buddhist festival

summary: A military attack on a festival in Sagaing region, Myanmar, has resulted in significant casualties, making victim identification difficult, locals reported to the BBC. The event was also a protest against army rule, with both witnesses and the exiled civilian government confirming the junta's target.

title: Kemi Badenoch Pledges to Scrap Stamp Duty on Primary Homes to Cut Deficit
snippets: Leader pitches Conservatives as party of spending control with promise to drive down Britain’s deficit

Leader announces tax cut plan in policy-heavy speech aimed at boosting beleaguered party’s fiscal credibility

The Conservatives will scrap stamp duty on sales of primary residences if they win the next election, Kemi Badenoch has said in a policy-heavy speech designed to improve her party’s

Party leader says measure is a ‘bad tax’ and scrapping it would free up the housing market and improve social mobility

Voting in the Labour deputy leadership election opens today. Lucy Powell, the former Commons leader, is seen as the favourite and, as Jessica Elgot
titles: Badenoch vows to scrap stamp duty
Tories will scrap stamp duty on primary residences, Kemi Badenoch tells conference
Tories would abolish stamp duty, Badenoch tells party conference – UK politics live
summary: The Conservative Party leader, Kemi Badenoch, has promised to eliminate stamp duty on sales of primary residences to reduce Britain's deficit and boost the party's fiscal reputation. This policy, aimed at freeing up the housing market and enhancing social mobility, was announced in a speech focusing on fiscal responsibility. Concurrently, the Labour deputy leadership election begins, with Lucy Powell viewed as the frontrunner.

title: Mariners' Raleigh Gifts Bat to Fan After ALDS Game 3 Win Over Tigers
snippets: After the game, Cal Raleigh posed alongside the fan with an autographed bat to say thanks.

They say never meet your heroes, but sometimes fate has other plans. While the Seattle Mariners were busy celebrating an 8-4 win over the Detroit Tigers in Game 3 of their ALDS matchup — to take a 2-1 series lead — one fan got a couple more reasons to cheer.
titles: 'Dump 61 Here': Raleigh meets fan who caught his home run ball

summary: Following the Seattle Mariners' 8-4 victory over the Detroit Tigers in Game 3 of their ALDS matchup, securing a 2-1 series lead, Cal Raleigh, a player from the Mariners, expressed gratitude to a fan by posing for a photo and gifting an autographed bat.

The New York Yankees have forced a Game 4 against the Blue Jays after defeating Toronto 9-6 in Game 3 of the American League Divisional Series (ALDS). The Blue Jays got up to an early 6-1 lead in the third inning before the Yankees rallied back. Game 4 will be at Yankee Stadium Wednesday at 7:08 [&#
titles: Blue Jays’ Louis Varland to start Game 4 vs. Yankees

summary: The New York Yankees defeated the Toronto Blue Jays 9-6 in Game 3 of the ALDS, overcoming an early 6-1 deficit. The discussion centers on whether Blue Jays' Shane Bieber was pulled too early by manager John Schneider. The Yankees' victory forces a Game 4 at Yankee Stadium.

title: NHL Openers: Penguins, Panthers, and Avalanche Secure Wins
snippets: Musings: Penguins 3, Rangers 0 (Season Opener)&

Justin Brazeau potted his first two goals of the season while Arturs Silovs impressed in net, stopping all 25 shots to earn his first career shutout in his Pittsburgh Penguins debut as they win 3-0 over the New York Rangers.
Frank Nazar opened the scoring on the new NHL season while Jesper Boqvist potted the game-winning goal for the Florida Panthers as they beat Chicago Blackhawks 3-2.
Martin Necas found the back of the net twice while Cale Makar and Nathan MacKinnon both added two assists as the Colorado Avalanche beat the Los Angeles Kings 4-1.
titles: Musings: Penguins 3, Rangers 0 (Season Opener) - NHL.com
NHL Highlights: Penguins 3, Rangers 0
NHL Highlights: Panthers 3, Blackhawks 2
NHL Highlights: Avalanche 4, Kings 1
summary: In the NHL season openers, the Pittsburgh Penguins defeated the New York Rangers 3-0, with Justin Brazeau scoring twice and Arturs Silovs achieving a shutout in his debut. The Florida Panthers won against the Chicago Blackhawks 3-2, with Jesper Boqvist scoring the decisive goal. Meanwhile, the Colorado Avalanche triumphed over the Los Angeles Kings 4-1, featuring two goals from Martin Necas and two assists each from Cale Makar and Nathan MacKinnon.

title: New Zealand Oceans Warming 34% Faster, Risking NZ$206bn in Assets
snippets:
NZ$180bn worth of housing and $26bn of infrastructure at risk of flooding and storm damage, new government report finds

New Zealand’s oceans are warming 34% faster than the global average, with NZ$180bn (US$104bn) worth of housing at risk of flooding, a new report about the nation’s marine
The seas around New Zealand are warming much faster than global averages, scientists said Wednesday in a new study warning how climate change could batter the island nation.
titles: New Zealand oceans warming 34% faster than global average, putting homes and industry at risk, report finds
New Zealand's seas warming faster than global average: Report
summary: A new report reveals that New Zealand's oceans are warming 34% faster than the global average, putting NZ$180bn (US$104bn) of housing and NZ$26bn of infrastructure at risk of flooding and storm damage. This study underscores the significant threat climate change poses to the island nation.

title: Tesla Launches Cheaper Model Y and 3, Prices Start at $36,990
snippets: Tesla debuts cheaper versions of Model Y and Model 3 electric vehicles&n
The long-awaited cheaper Model 3 and Model Y are finally here, but they start at $36,990 and $39,990, respectively -- just a few thousand dollars less than Tesla's current offerings.
titles: Tesla debuts cheaper versions of Model Y and Model 3 electric vehicles - Axios
Tesla reveals slightly cheaper ‘standard’ versions of the Model 3 and Model Y
summary: Elon Musk announced Tesla will sell more affordable versions of the Model Y to meet high demand, acknowledging the current price is too high for many consumers. The cheaper trims of the Model Y and Model 3 are now available, starting at $39,990 and $36,990, respectively. These prices, while lower, remain closer to $40,000, slightly missing the mass-market target price of under $30,000 that investors hoped for.
